thread.title: Broncos granted interviews with three candidates for head-coaching job
thread.title_full: Broncos granted interviews with three candidates for head-coaching job

author: Cameron Wolfe, Nicki Jhabvala
title: Broncos granted interviews with three candidates for head-coaching job
text:
Broncos granted interviews with three candidates for head-coaching job Share this: Click to share on Tumblr (Opens in new window) John Konstantaras, Getty Images Special teams coach Dave Toub of the Kansas City Chiefs looks on in the first half of the preseason game against the Green Bay Packers on August 28, 2014 at Lambeau Field in Green Bay, Wisconsin.   
The Broncos have asked and received permission to interview Miami defensive coordinator Vance Joseph and Kansas City special teams coordinator Dave Toub for their head coaching position, according to the NFL source. 
Kyle Shanahan, the Falcons’ offensive coordinator and the son of former Broncos head coach Mike Shanahan, is also scheduled to interview with the team Saturday. 
Per NFL rules, the Broncos can talk to Toub this week because the Chiefs have a first-round bye in the playoffs. For Joseph, they will have to wait until next week since the Dolphins face the Steelers in a wild-card game Sunday. If Miami wins Sunday, the Broncos will have to interview him in Miami. If the Dolphins are eliminated, they can do it here. Tags: January 03, 2017, 7:52 pm   Jhabvala vs. Kiz: Is Kyle Shanahan the right fit as Broncos head coach? January 03, 2017, 4:21 pm As Gary Kubiak said a tearful goodbye to the Broncos, John Elway was already saddled up and ready to go hunting for a new coach. Kansas City Chiefs’ Dave Toub could follow John Harbaugh’s path in NFL January 03, 2017, 12:55 pm Andy Reid has called Dave Toub the best special teams coach in the NFL, and his work with the Kansas City Chiefs this season has done nothing to dispute the assessment. Brock Osweiler to start for Houston Texans against Oakland Raiders January 03, 2017, 12:27 pm Brock Osweiler will start at quarterback for the Houston Texans on Saturday in their wild-card game against the Oakland Raiders.
